text: through some miscommunication with my wife, im carless today, so lets lyft it over to ZGF

<!here|@here> that was a cool tour of ZGF space.  I started a quick capture of notes and takeaways: <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/document/d/1QjyCLoNmwjgsJYXGO2KU-Ep4mf9sHB57wtljSqQT_UE/edit?usp=sharing>

I saw Felix and Lee both taking pictures.  Please add them here: <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2hvp3pmOYCFdVJUVmF4QVZwMkU>
<@U0ML49XU0|dennishanley> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/dennishanley/F2SNZ0PU7/idea_-_zgf_tour_102116|Meeting Notes/Idea - ZGF Tour 102116>

Please add to notes and be loud about your takeaways.  What sticks with me most -
This space in SW fits 9 people full time as well as wood shop and plenty of maker space, all within an A1 building
- Cool idea: a dedicated space to take photos

- Learning: most pieces of furniture were adjustable or easily moveable:
Height adjustable benches
Storage bins, on wheels, that fit beneath the work benches
Places to stage/store in progress work

- Learning: ZGF was able to grow into a smart space over time.  Don’t start by trying to do everything.  Learn as you grow!
- Learning: order plenty of hand tools; they have a manner of walking away
Had a good session with <@U02F8LF2X> . We only made it through the Nest but it showed us where we need to improve our process before we go on.
I’m going to spend some time reconciling the Equipment pages of the spreadsheet
before we reconvene and battle the next products
So on Monday we will attack another round of this.
Also there is a free tradeshow in February that is held every year in Anaheim, CA that is a combo for lots of industries
<http://epromos.ubmcanon.com/PDFs/Event_Sales/2017/Anaheim/Floor_Plans/Anaheim_2017_All_Shows_Floor_Plan.pdf>

right now, is there any equipment impact to pricing or the sprint felix is doing on floorplan?

combines electronic mfg, micro/nano tech, medical, medical packaging, CAD, precision machining, supply chain, plastics, automations, control, robotics, health and beauty packaging, pharmaceuticals and general packaging
there will be some impact to felix’s process if we find machines not useful
and we already found more things we need
but not crazy giant
and pricing should be on the order of < $10k
<http://anaheim.ubmcanon.com/design-manufacturing>
ok, keep us posted on pricing, i think we need to do a comprehensive pricing catch up next week, i’ll book
and for now no impact to felix so let’s let him keep running
I think if anything we would reduce total cost after this exercise but we'll see.
